trans-unit.source: We will add a button labelled "Complete All" next to the existing button, and move both buttons down a line.
trans-unit.target: We will add a button labelled "Complete All" next to the existing button, and move both buttons down a line.

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio, open the res\layout\activity_to_do.xml file in your quickstart project, locate the LinearLayout element that contains the Button element named buttonAddToDo.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio, open the res\layout\activity_to_do.xml file in your quickstart project, locate the LinearLayout element that contains the Button element named buttonAddToDo.

trans-unit.source: Copy the LinearLayout and paste it immediately following the original one.
trans-unit.target: Copy the LinearLayout and paste it immediately following the original one.

trans-unit.source: Delete the Button element from the first LinearLayout.
trans-unit.target: Delete the Button element from the first LinearLayout.

trans-unit.source: This method handles the Click event for the new button.
trans-unit.target: This method handles the Click event for the new button.

trans-unit.source: The invokeApi method is called on the client, which sends a POST request to the new custom API.
trans-unit.target: The invokeApi method is called on the client, which sends a POST request to the new custom API.

trans-unit.source: The result returned by the custom API is displayed in a message dialog, as are any errors.
trans-unit.target: The result returned by the custom API is displayed in a message dialog, as are any errors.

trans-unit.source: From the Run menu, click Run app to start the project in the Android emulator, or in a connected Android device.
trans-unit.target: From the Run menu, click Run app to start the project in the Android emulator, or in a connected Android device.

trans-unit.source: This executes your app, built with the Android SDK, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This executes your app, built with the Android SDK, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type some text in Insert a TodoItem, then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type some text in Insert a TodoItem, then click Add.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step until you have added several todo items to the list.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step until you have added several todo items to the list.

trans-unit.source: Click the Complete All button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Complete All button.

trans-unit.source: A message dialog is displayed that indicates the number of items marked complete and the filtered query is executed again, which clears all items from the list.
trans-unit.target: A message dialog is displayed that indicates the number of items marked complete and the filtered query is executed again, which clears all items from the list.
